column2: Life in Babylon has always been difficult for the Rastafari faithful, and it has only gotten worse in recent times. The followers of Jah and the Ras Tafari have been pushed underground, forced to hide themselves from the authorities under penalty of imprisonment or even death. However, one day they hope to emerge and openly practice their faith once more...
The §YRastafarian§! pilgrims that flock to the holy site in §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! impress me with the depth and passion of their faith. I am tempted to convert in secrecy...
In secret, Rastafarian faithfuls have organized themselves as a community in this province. From there it converts others, grows, and protects their own.
column3: En secret, les fidèles se sont organisés en tant que communauté dans cette province. De là, la commaunauté convertit d'autres personnes, grandit et protège les siens.

column2: A High Priest in the Hidden Rastafarian society

Since the Voodoo religion first emerged in the New World, its followers have been persecuted and repressed by corrupt and hypocritical religious authorities. Now, the Voodoo faithful are once again forced to hide their devotion to Bondye until the day comes when they can proclaim their faith openly once more.

Before Old America won its independence from the Redcoats, true patriots were forced to hide their devotion to the Founding Fathers or be sent to the gallows. Those dark days have descended once again, but true Americanist patriots will not be deterred. They will once again rise up and overthrow the tyrannical rule of their oppressors...
The §YAmericanist§! pilgrims that flock to the holy site in §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! impress me with the depth and passion of their faith. I am tempted to convert in secrecy...
